title: The Philosophy Professor

dialogue.speaker: The Architect
dialogue.text: *now dressed as philosophy professor in classroom* You've just discovered the paradox of agency. Freedom is not the absence of consequence. It's your attitude toward consequence.

dialogue.speaker: The Classroom
dialogue.text: *filled with versions of Evan at different stages* We are all your moments of questioning! Every doubt, every insight, every paradox discovered!

dialogue.speaker: The Blackboard
dialogue.text: *equations morphing into questions* Freedom = Choice × Consequence ÷ Attitude... No wait... Freedom = Paradox²... Actually...

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: *seeing all his past selves* So this whole journey... was about learning to have the right attitude toward the paradox?

dialogue.speaker: The Architect
dialogue.text: *adjusting professorial glasses* Not the 'right' attitudethat would be another trap. But AN attitude. The choice to engage with consequence rather than flee from it.

dialogue.speaker: All the Evans
dialogue.text: *in chorus* We choose our relationship to choice itself! We freely decide how to relate to freedom! The paradox includes our response to the paradox!

scene_context: The Architect appears as a philosophy professor with a classroom full of Evans at different stages of understanding, teaching that freedom lies not in escaping paradox but in choosing how to relate to it.
philosophical_theme: Freedom as attitude toward the inevitable paradox of agency
visual_elements: A classroom where time layers, multiple Evans learning simultaneously, equations that refuse to stabilize, wisdom dressed in academic robes
